repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: missing opts of matchfuzzy when fuzzy exists in cot.
Solution: add fuzzyopts in vim.lps.completion.BufferOpts

Fix https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32968

comment_data.body:
If people want to screw around with the matching then they are going to ask for all kinds of stuff. Adding "fuzzyopts" is obviously too narrow. The usual way we approach this is to add some kind of `filter` fn.

Something like this (just a sketch):

```suggestion
    local result = filterfn and filterfn({ value }, prefix) or vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -257,7 +257,13 @@ local function match_item_by_value(value, prefix)
     return true
   end
   if vim.o.completeopt:find('fuzzy') ~= nil then
-    return next(vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix)) ~= nil
+    local fuzzyopts = vim.tbl_get(buf_handles, api.nvim_get_current_buf(), 'fuzzyopts')
+    if fuzzyopts and next(fuzzyopts) == nil then
+      fuzzyopts = nil
+    end
+    local result = fuzzyopts and vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix, fuzzyopts)
+      or vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix)

comment_data.body:
Just above this is a `convert` function. That's a big hint that a `filter` function would be a natural counterpart.

This pattern keeps coming up. I hope that future PRs will consider this pattern, instead of adding random options.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -676,14 +682,15 @@ end
 --- @class vim.lsp.completion.BufferOpts
 --- @field autotrigger? boolean  Default: false When true, completion triggers automatically based on the server's `triggerCharacters`.
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table Transforms an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
+--- @field fuzzyopts? table vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict

comment_data.body: Good idea. I was kind of hoping that starting from any idea would revive the discussion on what it should ultimately look like.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -257,7 +257,13 @@ local function match_item_by_value(value, prefix)
     return true
   end
   if vim.o.completeopt:find('fuzzy') ~= nil then
-    return next(vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix)) ~= nil
+    local fuzzyopts = vim.tbl_get(buf_handles, api.nvim_get_current_buf(), 'fuzzyopts')
+    if fuzzyopts and next(fuzzyopts) == nil then
+      fuzzyopts = nil
+    end
+    local result = fuzzyopts and vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix, fuzzyopts)
+      or vim.fn.matchfuzzy({ value }, prefix)

comment_data.body: There's https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30936 for that. Looks like we don't need fuzzyopts
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -676,14 +682,15 @@ end
 --- @class vim.lsp.completion.BufferOpts
 --- @field autotrigger? boolean  Default: false When true, completion triggers automatically based on the server's `triggerCharacters`.
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table Transforms an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
+--- @field fuzzyopts? table vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict

comment_data.body: I can't guess how to pass options to matchfuzzy called in #30936.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -676,14 +682,15 @@ end
 --- @class vim.lsp.completion.BufferOpts
 --- @field autotrigger? boolean  Default: false When true, completion triggers automatically based on the server's `triggerCharacters`.
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table Transforms an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
+--- @field fuzzyopts? table vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict

comment_data.body: #30936 (outdated at the moment) has `filter` callback that could be used to call `matchfuzzy` with custom options instead. `filter` doesn't seem to be present on the `master` branch.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table Transforms an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
+--- @field fuzzyopts? table vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict

comment_data.body: Regardless of the discussion: `table` word is redundant here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_regular_data.body:
```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/builtin_types.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/builtin_types.lua
index 9dd0374486..a0b16ee4a2 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/builtin_types.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/builtin_types.lua
@@ -25,6 +25,11 @@
 --- @field variables table<string,any>
 --- @field windows integer[]

+--- @class vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict
+--- @field matchseq? any
+--- @field limit? integer
+--- @field camelcase? boolean
+
 --- @alias vim.fn.getjumplist.ret [vim.fn.getjumplist.ret.item[], integer]

 --- @class vim.fn.getjumplist.ret.item
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua
index c603f97430..06ecc56970 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua
@@ -682,7 +682,7 @@ end
 --- @class vim.lsp.completion.BufferOpts
 --- @field autotrigger? boolean  Default: false When true, completion triggers automatically based on the server's `triggerCharacters`.
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table Transforms an LSP CompletionItem to |complete-items|.
---- @field fuzzyopts? table See third parameter of |matchfuzzy()|
+--- @field fuzzyopts? vim.fn.matchfuzzy.dict

 ---@param client_id integer
 ---@param bufnr integer
```
(and then `make doc`) would be nice. The location of `@class` may require moving somewhere else.
Currently there are many missing parameter classes for viml functions.  I think it is better to solve it on the eval side.

> Currently there are many missing parameter classes for viml functions. I think it is better to solve it on the eval side.

Perhaps, but until we come up with a better solution, that's all we'll have.
seems like no better way to automatically generate these things ? It must be done manually. So I added

title: feat(lsp.completion): user can control match behavior
